introduction: Reinforcement learning (RL) has revolutionized the field of robotics, enabling robots to learn complex tasks through experience.
This article will explore the evolution of RL in robotics from simple algorithms to embodied AI.

structure.title: **The Early Days of RL in Robotics**
subsections: The introduction of Q-learning and SARSA in the early 2000s
Initial challenges and limitations of these simple algorithms

structure.title: **Advancements in RL Algorithms**
subsections: The introduction of deep Q-networks (DQN) and policy gradients in the mid-2010s
Improved performance and capabilities of these advanced algorithms

structure.title: **The Rise of Embodied AI**
subsections: The combination of RL with computer vision, sensorimotor integration, and other AI techniques
Examples of embodied AI applications in robotics, such as learning complex tasks through experience

conclusion: A summary of the evolution of RL in robotics from simple algorithms to embodied AI
The potential for continued advancements and impact on the field of robotics
